content.title: Protection Plan
bullets: Current life insurance coverage is Rs.0; required coverage is Rs.6,461,050.
Estimated annual premium for term insurance: Rs.45,227.
No current health insurance; recommended coverage is Rs.10-15 lakh.
Critical health insurance gap if current coverage is less than Rs.5 lakh.

paragraphs: As you currently have no life insurance coverage, it is crucial to address this gap to ensure financial security for your dependents in the event of unforeseen circumstances. A term insurance policy with a coverage amount of Rs.6,461,050 is recommended. This will provide a safety net equivalent to approximately ten times your annual income, which is a standard benchmark for adequate life insurance coverage. The estimated annual premium for such a policy is around Rs.45,227, though this may vary based on factors such as age, health, and specific insurer policies.

In addition to life insurance, it is important to secure adequate health insurance coverage. Currently, you have no health insurance, which poses a significant risk. A family floater health insurance plan with a coverage amount of Rs.10-15 lakh is recommended to protect against high medical expenses. If your current health coverage is less than Rs.5 lakh, it is considered a critical gap that needs immediate attention. Prioritizing life insurance is essential if you have dependents, followed by securing health insurance to ensure comprehensive protection.
actions: Purchase a term life insurance policy with a coverage of Rs.6,461,050.
Set aside approximately Rs.45,227 annually for the term insurance premium.
Evaluate and purchase a family floater health insurance plan with Rs.10-15 lakh coverage.
Review and increase health insurance coverage if currently below Rs.5 lakh.
Consult with a financial advisor to tailor the protection plan to your specific needs.
